articles.description: At Lord’s on Saturday for a thrilling Test match, the writer Kathy Lette had relied on her friend Stephen Fry to educate her in the finer aspects of the game. By Sunday, she had to go into hiding after that ‘dubious stumping’ made all Aussies public enemy No …
articles.content: I was never a big cricket fan. Hell, Ive had marriages that have lasted less time than a test match. It seemed like the sporting version of tantric sex where the only thing that gets sticky is the wi… [+738 chars]

articles.title: 'Tumultuous week in summer that shows best and worst of cricket'
articles.description: Cricket has had to confront difficult questions about its image and the values it stands after a tumultuous week on and off the field, writes Dan Roan.

articles.author: sport
articles.title: Diplomacy burnt to Ashes: Now Australian PM Albanese also wades into cricket row
articles.description: The British and Australian prime ministers have traded verbal bouncers after a controversial Test match between the two sides that has rocked the usually genteel world of cricket.
articles.content:
• Both the UK and Australian prime ministers have now had their say about Jonny Bairstow's controversial stumping during the second Ashes Test.

articles.description: Wides, lbw calls, swing - plenty of things were different in white-ball cricket back then | ESPNcricinfo.com
